data.title: List of Cities in UAE
data.meta_description: The United Arab Emirates (UAE) is a fascinating country located in the southeastern region of the Arabian Peninsula. It's a federation of seven emirates, each with its unique character and offerings. Think of 7 different cities, each with its vibe, all in one country. Abu Dhabi, the capital, is packed with museums and mosques.
data.text:
Last Updated : 23 Feb, 2024

Improve

List of Cities in UAE: The United Arab Emirates (UAE) is a fascinating country located in the southeastern region of the Arabian Peninsula. It’s a federation of seven emirates, each with its unique character and offerings. Think of 7 different cities, each with its vibe, all in one country. Abu Dhabi, the capital, is packed with museums and mosques. Dubai boasts sky-high buildings and thrilling shows.

In this article, we have provided a list of cities in UAE and also given detailed information on the cities.

List of Cities in UAE

The table provided below shows the list of cities in UAE with their emirates and a short description of the city.

City Emirate Description Abu Dhabi Abu Dhabi Capital city, cultural hub with Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque, Ferrari World, Yas Island Al Ain Abu Dhabi UNESCO World Heritage site with archaeological sites and oasis Dubai Dubai Global city, famous for Burj Khalifa, Dubai Fountain, luxury shopping Jebel Ali Dubai Major port and industrial hub with man-made Jebel Ali Free Zone Sharjah Sharjah Cultural capital with museums, art galleries, heritage areas like Heart of Sharjah Khorfakkan Sharjah East coast city with beaches, mountains, and scenic coastline Ajman Ajman The laid-back city with beaches, Dhayah Fort, relaxed atmosphere Masfout Ajman Mountain town with Masfout Castle, known for Friday market Umm Al Quwain Umm Al Quwain A tranquil city with mangroves, Dreamland Aqua Park, Falaj Al Mualla heritage area Al Sufouh Umm Al Quwain Beach resort town with water sports and leisure activities Ras Al Khaimah Ras Al Khaimah Adventure capital with Jebel Jais mountain, zip-lining, desert adventures Al Jazirah Al Hamra Ras Al Khaimah Historic town with abandoned village and traditional architecture Fujairah Fujairah East coast city with beaches, diving, snorkeling, Al Bidiyah Mosque Dibba Fujairah Town known for its traditional dhow building and scenic coastline

Abu Dhabi

Capital city of the UAE, known for its cultural landmarks like Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque.

Home to thrilling entertainment like Ferrari World and Yas Island.

Offers a mix of modern and traditional experiences.

Bustling metropolis with a growing tourism industry.

Beautiful coastline and desert landscapes nearby.

Dubai

Global city famous for its iconic Burj Khalifa skyscraper.

Showcases luxury shopping, extravagant entertainment, and futuristic architecture.

Offers diverse activities like desert safaris, water sports, and theme parks.

Bustling with international residents and tourists.

Constantly evolving and pushing the boundaries of innovation.

Sharjah

Nicknamed the “Cultural Capital of the UAE” with numerous museums and art galleries.

Offers historical immersion through its souqs and heritage areas like Heart of Sharjah.

Provides a more relaxed and family-friendly atmosphere compared to Dubai.

Known for its commitment to preserving Islamic culture and tradition.

Hosts various festivals and events throughout the year.

Ajman

Smallest emirate with a laid-back atmosphere and beautiful beaches.

Offers historical sites like Dhayah Fort and a Friday market known for its local crafts.

Popular for water sports and outdoor activities on its coastline.

Provides a more affordable alternative to other major cities in the UAE.

Offers a glimpse into traditional Emirati life.

Umm Al Quwain

Tranquil city known for its natural beauty and archaeological sites.

Features mangroves, beaches, and the Dreamland Aqua Park for water fun.

Offers historical exploration through its Falaj Al Mualla heritage area.

Provides a peaceful escape from the hustle and bustle of other cities.

Ideal for nature lovers and those seeking relaxation.

Ras Al Khaimah

Nicknamed the “Adventure Capital of the UAE” with activities like mountain hikes and zip-lining.

Offers stunning scenery with the Jebel Jais mountain range and dramatic landscapes.

Provides desert adventures for thrill-seekers and off-road enthusiasts.

Boasts historical sites like Al Jazirah Al Hamra, an abandoned village.

Offers a diverse range of experiences for adventurous travelers.

Fujairah

Only emirate on the east coast with stunning beaches and diving spots.

Home to the oldest mosque in the UAE, the Al Bidiyah Mosque.

Offers scenic mountains and valleys for hiking and exploration.

Provides a unique cultural experience with its distinct traditions.

Ideal for relaxation, diving, and exploring natural beauty.

Summary – List of Cities in UAE

The United Arab Emirates (UAE) is a captivating country featuring seven distinct emirates, each offering its own unique experiences. In the bustling capital city of Abu Dhabi, visitors can explore cultural landmarks like the Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque and enjoy thrilling entertainment at Ferrari World. Dubai, a global city known for its towering skyscrapers and luxurious shopping, provides diverse activities ranging from desert safaris to theme parks. Sharjah, dubbed the “Cultural Capital,” offers a more relaxed atmosphere with numerous museums and historical sites. Ajman boasts laid-back beaches and historical landmarks, while Umm Al Quwain provides a tranquil escape with its natural beauty and water parks. Ras Al Khaimah caters to adventure enthusiasts with mountain hikes and desert adventures, while Fujairah, on the east coast, entices with pristine beaches and cultural experiences like diving and exploring ancient mosques. Each emirate presents a unique blend of modernity, tradition, and natural beauty, making the UAE an enticing destination for all types of travelers.

FAQs on List of Cities in UAE

What is the largest city in the UAE?

Dubai is the largest city in the UAE, known for its modern architecture and vibrant culture.

How many cities are in the UAE?

The UAE has 7 main cities, including Abu Dhabi, Dubai, Sharjah, Ajman, Fujairah, Ras Al Khaimah, and Umm Al Quwain.

Is Dubai the capital of the UAE?

No, Abu Dhabi is the capital city of the UAE.

What are the major cities in the UAE by population?

Major cities by population are Dubai, Abu Dhabi, Sharjah, Al Ain, and Ajman.

Are there any historical cities in the UAE?

Yes, cities like Sharjah, known for its cultural heritage, and Al Ain, known for its historic sites, are significant.
